reference.title: Marker Types
reference.shortdesc: Marker types allow you to embed information in your source documents and add functional elements to your generated output.

section.p:
For example, you can use markers to create popup windows and context-sensitive help topics.
DropDownEnd The DropdownEnd marker should be inserted at the end of the text that you want to display in an expand/collapse section. This marker indicates the end of the content you want to display in an expand/collapse section.
Filename The Filename marker should be inserted if you want to specify output filenames when FrameMaker generated output. Specify the desired name for the file as the marker text for the marker.
PopupEnd The PopupEnd marker should be inserted at the text that will display in a popup window. This marker indicates the end of the text you want to display in a popup window.
TopicAlias The TopicAlias marker should be inserted in any topic that you want to use as a context-sensitive help topic. Specify the topic ID you wish to assign to the topic as the marker text for the marker.
